citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Upon approaching the goat pen, male goat “Horny”, was resting in the shelter. When patrons with food approached the
fence, the goat appeared to struggle to get up and then walked with a stiff gait. As he stood at the fence, I was able to see
that his front hooves are overgrown, flattened, misshapen, and curved to the side. I was unable to clearly visualize the
hindlimb hooves. As the goat returned to the shelter, the gait was abnormal as he kicked the left hind limb out to shift
weight. Once in the shelter, the goat dropped to his front knees and struggled to get in a sitting position. He ended up in
an awkward position with his face directly against the back of the shelter. He made no attempt to turn around. The goat is
experiencing discomfort due to the condition of its hooves.
The licensee stated that the goat has a history of chronic hoof issues and is overdue for a hoof trim. The scheduled
appointment with the veterinarian was canceled 2 weeks ago due to weather and rescheduled for the the end of next
week. Regular trimming and evaluation of the hooves by the veterinarian is important to prevent overgrowth and to
minimize pain and discomfort. The facility shall ensure that appropriate methods to prevent and diagnose the hoof issues
are established and followed.
Correct by April 12, 2024
The veterinarian was called for a consult and the hooves will be trimmed on the April 10, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Upon approaching the goat pen, male goat “Horny”, was resting in the shelter. When patrons with food approached the 
fence, the goat appeared to struggle to get up and then walked with a stiff gait. As he stood at the fence, I was able to see 
that his front hooves are overgrown, flattened, misshapen, and curved to the side. I was unable to clearly visualize the 
hindlimb hooves. As the goat returned to the shelter, the gait was abnormal as he kicked the left hind limb out to shift 
weight. Once in the shelter, the goat dropped to his front knees and struggled to get in a sitting position. He ended up in 
an awkward position with his face directly against the back of the shelter. He made no attempt to turn around. The goat is 
experiencing discomfort due to the condition of its hooves.  
 
The licensee stated that the goat has a history of chronic hoof issues and is overdue for a hoof trim. The scheduled 
appointment with the veterinarian was canceled 2 weeks ago due to weather and rescheduled for the the end of next 
week. Regular trimming and evaluation of the hooves by the veterinarian is important to prevent overgrowth and to 
minimize pain and discomfort. The facility shall ensure that appropriate methods to prevent and diagnose the hoof issues 
are established and followed.  
 
Correct by April 12, 2024  
The veterinarian was called for a consult and the hooves will be trimmed on the April 10, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
